root_causes: Script references the parent question variable B5dDKx3 instead of the specific sub-variable for the answer option (expected variable B5dDKx3_5).
Range check is applied to the wrong variable; a Multi (checkbox/subquestion) should validate the sub-variable that represents the answer option.
No handling/instruction to confirm the internal coding for the checkbox (e.g. whether selected=1 or some other code).
instructions: Change the variable referenced from B5dDKx3 to the sub-variable B5dDKx3_5.

Validate the sub-variable against the correct codes for a checkbox option. If the checkbox is coded as 1 when selected, use: sel if miss(B5dDKx3_5) or ~range(B5dDKx3_5,1,1). If your system codes the selected state with 5, use range(B5dDKx3_5,5,5). Confirm the internal coding and adjust the range accordingly.
If special codes (97/98/99) are possible for this sub-variable, include them in the allowed set or exclude them explicitly per project rules.

root_causes: Script references the parent question variable B5dDKx4 instead of the expected sub-variable B5dDKx4_5.
Range check is applied to the parent variable rather than the specific checkbox/subquestion variable representing answer code 5.
No confirmation/handling of the actual selected-value coding for the sub-variable.
instructions: Update the script to reference B5dDKx4_5 (the sub-variable for answer code 5) instead of B5dDKx4.

Validate B5dDKx4_5 against the correct selection code. If selected=1, use: sel if miss(B5dDKx4_5) or ~range(B5dDKx4_5,1,1). If selected uses code 5, use range(...,5,5). Verify the coding and adjust accordingly.
Add handling for any project-defined special codes (97/98/99) if they apply to this sub-variable.

root_causes: Script uses the parent variable B5dDKx5 rather than the specific sub-variable B5dDKx5_5 that represents the answer option.
Range check is therefore applied to the wrong variable (parent vs sub-variable).
No explicit handling/confirmation of the checkbox selected-value coding.
instructions: Reference B5dDKx5_5 in the validation logic instead of B5dDKx5.

Validate the sub-variable for the correct coding of 'selected'. If the checkbox is coded 1 when checked, use: sel if miss(B5dDKx5_5) or ~range(B5dDKx5_5,1,1). If it uses code 5 for selection, use range(...,5,5). Confirm and adjust to the dataset's coding.
Include handling for any special codes (97/98/99) on the sub-variable, if applicable.

root_causes: The script checks numeric bounds for each sub-variable but does not implement the expected cross-field/custom validation function validateB5d(...) that is declared in the question attributes.
No check for any project-specific special codes or additional validation rules implied by question attributes (e.g. AutoCheckOther or other inter-variable constraints).
instructions: Keep the existing numeric-range checks (sel if ~miss(v) and (~range(v,0,9999))) for each B5ex1_1..B5ex1_4, since LowerLimit=0 and UpperLimit=9999 are enforced correctly with inclusive bounds.

Add execution of the declared validation routine validateB5d("S7_1","B5ex1_4","hDUMB5eCol1_2","B5eDKx1") (or incorporate its logic) so that the cross-field validation defined in question attributes is enforced. Ensure the routine runs against the correct variables after range checks.
Verify and handle any special codes (97/98/99) or precision requirements if the project rules require them, and ensure the script does not flag permitted special codes as out-of-range.
